Detailed Description

Platform-independent interface for RKH trace facility.

When a program needs to be traced, it has to generate some information each time it reaches a "significant step" (certain instruction in the program's source code). In the standard terminology, this step is called a trace point, and the tracing information which is generated at that point is called a trace event. A program containing one or more of this trace points is named instrumented application.

There is one class of trace events: RKH trace events, which are generated by the RKH source code.

The definition of events and the mapping between these and their corresponding names is hard-coded in the RKH implementation. Therefore, these events are common for all the state-machine applications and never change (they are always traced). The trace events are associated with a integer value and are explicity listed and defined (enumerated) as shown below in this file.

The standard defines that the trace system has to store some information for each trace event (also named arguments) being generated, including, at least, the following:

  • the trace event identifier (RKHTR_EVENTS enumerated list),
  • instrumented application (state-machine),
  • a timestamp (optional),
  • any extra data that the system wants to associate with the event (optional).

When the RKH reachs a trace point, all the information related to it has to be stored somewhere before it can be retrieved, in order to be analyzed. This place is named trace stream.

Typedef Documentation

typedef rkhuint16 RKHTS_T

Defines the size of trace timestamp. The valid values [in bits] are 8, 16 or 32. Default is 8. This type is configurable via the preprocessor switch RKH_SIZEOF_TIMESTAMP.

Definition at line 218 of file rkhtrace.h.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum RKHTR_CFGLOG

Defines logged or not the trace events for a instrumented state-machine. It's used as argument of rkh_trconfig() function. This number isn't internally used by RKH trace module.

Definition at line 112 of file rkhtrace.h.

enum RKHTR_CFGPRT

Defines printable or not the trace events for a instrumented state-machine. It's used as argument of rkh_trconfig() function. This number isn't internally used by RKH trace module.

Definition at line 100 of file rkhtrace.h.

enum RKHTR_CTRL

Enable or disable the trace facility for a instrumented state-machine. It's used as argument of rkh_trcontrol() function.

Definition at line 88 of file rkhtrace.h.

enum RKHTR_EVENTS

List of event traced.

The list below defines the available trace events. This traces are placed within RKH source code, at key points of interest, called trace points.

Enumerator:
RKHTR_EVENT 

If it's enabled (1) records the triggering event.

RKHTR_TRN_SRC 

If it's enabled (1) records the source state of transition.

RKHTR_TRN_TGT 

If it's enabled (1) records the target state of transition.

RKHTR_NXT_STATE 

If it's enabled (1) records the next state of transition.

RKHTR_INT_TRAN 

If it's enabled (1) records the internal transition.

RKHTR_ENTRY 

If it's enabled (1) records the entered state.

RKHTR_EXIT 

If it's enabled (1) records the exited state.

RKHTR_INIT_HSM 

If it's enabled (1) records the initialization process of state-machine.

RKHTR_SGT_TGT 

If it's enabled (1) records the target state of transition segment.

RKHTR_RTN_CODE 

If it's enabled (1) records the code returned by rkh_engine() function.

RKHTR_NUM_ENEX 

If it's enabled (1) records the number of entered and exited states.

RKHTR_NUM_ACTSGT 

If it's enabled (1) records the number of transition actions and transition segments.

Definition at line 126 of file rkhtrace.h.

enum RKHTR_RC

Return codes from rkh_trgetnext() function.

Definition at line 77 of file rkhtrace.h.

Function Documentation

void rkh_trace_close ( void   ) 

Close the tracing session.

This is a platform-dependent function invoked through the macro rkh_trclose(). The application must implement this function.

void rkh_trace_flush ( void   ) 

Flush the trace stream.

This is a platform-dependent function invoked through the macro rkh_trflush(). When the RKH trace an event, all the information related to it has to be stored somewhere before it can be retrieved, in order to be analyzed. This place is a trace stream. Frequently, events traced are stored in the stream until it is flushed.

RKHTS_T rkh_trace_getts ( void   ) 

Retrieves a timestamp to be placed in a trace event.

This is a platform-dependent function invoked through the macro rkh_trgetts(). The data returned is defined in compile-time by means of RKH_SIZEOF_TIMESTAMP preprocessor directive.

Returns:

Timestamp.

void rkh_trace_open ( void   ) 

Open the tracing session.

This is a platform-dependent function invoked through the macro rkh_tropen(). The application must implement this function. At a minimum, the function must configure the trace stream by calling rkh_trinit().

void rkh_trconfig ( HUInt  trix,
HUInt  log,
HUInt  print 
)

Each of instrumented state-machine applications has its own tracing facility configuration.

Parameters:
trix instrumented state-machine descriptor. This number must be unique.
log defines logged or not the trace events for a instrumented state-machine. Use RKH_TRLOG or RKH_TRNLOG for that. This number isn't internally used by RKH trace module.
print defines printable or not the trace events for a instrumented state-machine. Use RKH_TRPRINT or RKH_TRNPRINT for that. This number isn't internally used by RKH trace module.
void rkh_trcontrol ( HUInt  trix,
HUInt  opt 
)

Starts or stops the tracing session of an instrumented state-machine.

Parameters:
trix instrumented state-machine descriptor. This number must be unique.
opt control option. Use RKH_TRSTART to start recording events.
void rkh_trevt ( RKHTREVT_T *  ptre  ) 

Post a trace event in the stream. The event is stored by copy, not by reference.

When the RKH trace an event, all the information related to it has to be stored within the trace stream. This function is indirectly called by means of mktrevt() macro.

Parameters:
ptre pointer to the trace event that is to be placed in the stream.
RKHTRCFG_T* rkh_trgetcfg ( HUInt  trix  ) 

Retrieves the tracing configuration that specifies the behavior of the session.

Parameters:
trix instrumented state-machine descriptor. This number must be unique.
Returns:

Pointer to tracing configuration structure.

HUInt rkh_trgetnext ( RKHTREVT_T *  ptre  ) 

Get a trace event from the stream.

Parameters:
ptre pointer to the buffer into which the event retrieved will be copied.
Returns:

RKH_TROK if the event was successfully removed from the stream, otherwise error code.

rkhuint16 rkh_trgetqty ( void   ) 

Retrieves the number of trace events stored in the stream.

Returns:

Number of trace events stored in the stream.

void rkh_trinit ( void   ) 

Inits the trace facility module.
